name: Chateau Dupre Hotel

reviews.title: This Is The Best Spot
reviews.text: The Chateau Dupre is for the people who want to experience life in the French Quarters. If you are use to staying in expensive five star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: resorts, hotels, and in luxury suites then this is not the place for you. On the other hand, if you are like me and you came to New Orleans to experince life in the French Quarters then by all means book this hotel. This hotel is aboput 3 blocks from Burbon street and
reviews.title: Find Somewhere else to stay

likes.liked: — If I must pick one, I guess I would say the location.
likes.disliked: — The extras they charge that you never use.

reviews.text: it is on the same street as the House of Blues and Club 300. Not to mention its is within walking distnace of the Riverwalk mall and the Harrah casino.
reviews.title: awful!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel during Essence week-end and it was a wonderful
reviews.title: Not A three star not good

reviews.text: stay. The staff and the mangment was very hands on and willing to work and help all guests the whole week-end. For instance, when I got
reviews.title: Too many hidden charges

reviews.text: What a great little place right on Jackson Square. We were right where we needed to be. Our person, Melvina, helped us greatly and was very friendly. The price was right, location was right and we will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Great place on Jackson Square

likes.liked: — Location, beds were comfy, clean, coffee in room
likes.disliked: — We had to ask for coffee cups and towels.

reviews.text: Thank you, Melvina, for taking such good care of us!
reviews.title: The Best? You MUST be kidding

reviews.text: I have been going to New Orleans 2 to 3 times a year for the past 15 years and don't know how I missed this gem! The pictures on the website do not do them justice! The hotel is beautiful, the staff is WONDERFUL and the price is so low!! Thanks to Melvina and all of the staff for a fabulous stay! This is my new favorite New Orleans hotel! I will definately stay there EVERY time I'm in town and will highly recommend to all my friends to do the same!
reviews.title: My new favorite New Orleans Hotel!

likes.liked: — Value, Friendliness of staff, guest room

reviews.text: Great room at a great rate. There were some hidden charges however -- room safe and telephone. But still a great deal. The only drawback was the noisy garage at an adjacent hotel. Staff was extremely helpful on check-in and at check-out. Melvina provided us with some great information as we were checking out. I failed to get the names of other helpful staff members. I'd certainly stay here again. A great plus was the effeciency of the valet parking staff. Our vehichle was always there for us in a very short time.
reviews.title: Great room and price

reviews.text: We found the Chateau Dupre to be a typical inexpensive old hotel in the French Quarter. Great Location but be prepared to be "Up all night" with nightlife noise from the streets! If you are looking for anything quite avoid the Quarter! This whole area is a 24 hour party again. Our experience was saved by the great staff who treated our family in town for a funeral service with kindness and consideration! Melvina and her charming night staff at the front desk are very thoughtful and understanding.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff!
Hurricane Evacuation Perfect Plan
reviews.text: Karen did a fantastic job keeping me and my new husband calm trying to get out of town sunday afternoon. she was able to reserve a rental car for us which we got the airport in time to drive away and out of town. I want to also commend the manager marty who had his staff organized and prepared for the forthcoming storm. i saw a box full of flashlights, glow sticks, rope, extra sheets, twowels, radios. i hope the hotel fared okay. New Orleans is a wonderful town and we hope to return. definitely to the hotel Chateau DUpre.

reviews.title: The staff was great
reviews.text: Our stay at this Hotel was great. The staff was friendly and very helpful. As soon as we entered the door we were greated by Adonis working the front desk and Terry, the bellman. We arrived early before check-out and our bags were stored for us. A suggestion was made for breakfast at Mothers and when we returned they had a room ready for us. It was before noon and check in time wasn't for hours. Our room was clean and everything worked with no problems. The bed was comfortable and we got a good nights sleep every night. The adjoining restaurant was convenient and the continental breakfast, supplied with your stay, was nice and ample. The price of the room was quite fair for the location. We enjoyed our stay.

reviews.title: Great service
reviews.text: I just want to thank Adonis Fuvorite from the Chateau Dupre Hotel in New Orleans for great service. Even though the experience wasn't the best with the room we were given, Adonis was great in relating our problem to the manager and being forthright in suggestions on how to accommodate us. Her cooperation and perfessionalism made the experience much better than it was.

reviews.title: Great Hospitality
reviews.text: Thank you and we plan to return to New Orleans.

reviews.title: Will not stay there again
reviews.text: Sincerely ,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the good side, the hotel has a great location in the French Quarter, convenient to most of the major attractions.
reviews.title: Quaint little spot

likes.liked: — The walking distance to most action
likes.disliked: — Parking yourself a few blocks away- The somber atmosphere of the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A cute old little older hotel. Service was great at the front desk; very friendly and accomodating. Rooms are okay and are a good size. You can tell that there has been some work done to them. Location of the hotel is perfect: Decatur St... You are in walking distance to all the action. Even though we were there in March, it still gets pretty loud at night despite being a couple of streets from Burbon ST. The hotel is decent and for the price, you can't go wrong. Be prepared, however, to park your own vehicle at 20$/day a couple of blocks away. There is no valet parking as per the hotel's website.
reviews.title: Chateau Dupre is a Treat

reviews.text: Definitely check out Preservation Hall... get there early and be prepared for an amazing Jazz experience for 8$.
reviews.title: Friendliest and most helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looked like a good deal. We were only staying for 2 nights so we did not make a big deal about it. The halls were dark I did not even want to walk by myself. The door had about a 3/4 of an inch crack in the jam, you could see right into the hallway which meant we could hear the construction very well in the hall. The parking garage next door constantly had people honking as they came down the ramp. The rooms were old and dingy, the bathroom was small and not clean. Do not expect to see anyone at the desk and breakfast was supposed to be a warm breakfast and the lady had complained that she had overslept and would not be serving a warm breakfast. The price was good for a suite but the place was so old and dirty I would not stay there again. No matter the price.
reviews.title: Blah!

reviews.text: This hotel is not anything like it is portrayed. It was dirty, the TV didn't work, the safe didn't work, the door could not lock due to hole in area where lock would be. The pillows were dirty, hardly any lighting. Lots of rooms empty with door knobs off, no one at the front desk. No peace of mind. Would not recomend to anyone. There is no sign outside the hotel except a small name on the door. Very bad experience.
reviews.title: Not anything like portrayed.
Incompetent and proud of it!
reviews.text: If you have never stayed in a hotel before, you won't be disappointed. If you have come to expect things like a front desk staff (it is not staffed for check-in or check-out), coffee for your in-room coffeemaker, wake-up calls, a "Do not disturb" sign for your door, or a housekeeping staff that comes by two hours after your wake-up call rather than two hours before (8 AM maid visits during Mardi Gras?) then you should spend your money somewhere else. No matter how easy-going you are eventually you will tire of a staff that doesn't care, and is offended that you expect better.

reviews.title: Loved the Chateau Dupre
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the wonderful Chateau Dupre Hotel, a week before the hurricane. The staff was perrfect: layne, melissa, karen, marty. They knew all the best places to eat and tours to take. Such a sad event what miss Katrina did to New Orleans. Michelle and I wish the best.

The room was the size of a Barbee Dollhouse Bathroom. The only way you could curl your hair in the bathroom was turn sideways and then you could not look in the mirror. You could not even comb your hair and look straight into the mirror. Everything you need in the bathroom had to sit on the floor. Everything had to stay on the floor (makeup, combs, brushes, curling iron, etc.). Washing your hands was even an ordeal. You had to hold the towel between your legs (or lay it on the floor) until you finished washing your hands. No coffee after the first day, no cleaning of glasses, coffee maker and no new linens in bath after first day. No bathcloths after the first day. No closet door. The manager that was there in the afternoon and night was rude. It was dingy, dirty and dark. Will never, ever stay again. After two days, I moved to another hotel.
reviews.title: Never, never stay again
Rustic New Orleans
reviews.text: Quite nice. Has a rustic look and feel. GREAT location and easy to get to. Best location for me and two other girls who didn't want to pay a lot, be off the beaten path, or far from the casino and Dickey Brennen's Steakhouse. Staff was very nice; especially Terry Jerome (sweet young man). He was sure to set us off in the right direction. Compared to other hotels, parking was the cheapest we found. Just drive up front and they take it from there. Please be aware that sometimes there is noise even in this part of the Quarter...but so what :O) you're visiting New Orleans!

reviews.title: Big fun in the Big Easy
reviews.text: Picture it...two sisters on the lam from the families.....we chose Chateau Dupre off of the internet, once we arrived we never doubted our choice. The ambience of the hotel was great, as was the air conditioning! Coming back from Bourbon Street sweaty from the heat and humidity - imagine our delight in the frigid temps of the hotel. Adonis was a wealth of information, always provided with a smile. Michael the "everyman" of the place was so gracious and welcoming while showing us our room. Antoinette, our room hostess, was sad to see us leave. We were sad to leave too! We would recommend the hotel - sure..it has it's quirks, but that was part of the charm. The combination of price, location and character topped off by the warmth of the staff can't be beat.

reviews.title: Service With A Smile
reviews.text: We stayed in the Chateau Dupre and had the opportunity to meet one of the nicest hotel employees ever. Adonis who worked at the front desk greeted us with a friendly smile, patiently answered all our questions about the area, and went above and beyond in every way to insure the quality of our visit. I travel a lot in my job and this young lady made this trip better simply by her friendliness and attention to detail.

reviews.title: Terrific value!
reviews.text: The Chateau Dupre was a charming departure from the usual chain hotels. The room was decorated with an old world charm but clean with modern amenities.

reviews.title: Worst Hotel I've ever stayed in
reviews.text: Location wise, I do not believe I could have asked for a better spot. It's 5 minutes of walking distance to the French Market, Bourbon St., and the river front. Not to mention, it's surrounded by dozens of great restaurants.

reviews.title: Adonis was great!
reviews.text: Chateau Dupré has an excelent service, namely Ms. Adonis Favorite.

reviews.title: Excellent Staff and Service
reviews.text: Went over the fouth of july for some fun and adventure and I got just that. As soon as I checked in you can see it was going to be great. Greeted by this cool young kid who immediately picked up my bags and led me to the reception to check in. The young lady checking me in used my name several times and offered the bellmen to send my one little bag up to the room. Room was clean and fresh, like it was newly painted or something. Got directions to the nearest restaurants and clubs. Staff was great, hotel location unbeatable. I work for a small hotel in AK and I took ideas with me. Thanks Again! I'll be back.

As you can see from the date we stayed here, it's been 5 years. However, there are some issues that cannot be resolved. If you get a room in the front of the hotel, you will be facing Decatur St and the House of Blues is just a few doors away. Unfortunately, our stay coincided with Rap Night at the HOB. We were on the top floor, the entire room vibrated from the blasting music in all the traffic on the street. Next morning we moved to the back of the hotel, you only have 2 choices, front or back. All the views from the back are of a parking deck a few short steps away across a narrow alley, heard screeching tires from valet parking attendants all night long. So, if it's peace and quite you need, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Some issues cannot be corrected
The Essence Music Fiasco
reviews.text: This establishment played the staring role in the worst trip ever! It would seem that the toilet being constantly flooded would be bad enough, but no, they went and topped themselves by being infested with termites. Lastly, in an attempt to kill the termites maybe, the hotel has electrical problems that caused a fire, landing their guests in a “shelter-like” domain, that was surprisingly better compared to the Chateau Dupre.

reviews.title: Terrible/Need improvement
reviews.text: The Chateau Dupre' was not what I expected it to be. If you look on there website the picture looks like it would be a nice vintage style hotel. But once you check your whole overview while change. The picture looks very good but the only thing is they only have one of those rooms in the entire hotel. The rooms that don't have the lounge area is horrible. They had termites, the room i was staying in had electrical problems which caused me to have to scramble to gather all my things and move to another hotel. The only good thing about this hotel was three people that i think went out there way to make sure my stay would go a little bit better. One was this laundry lady name Anoittenete, she was very helpful and outgoing. Second was Adonis one the desk clerks. Third was John the bell doorman he was very helpful in taking our bags to our room. My overall experince was bad and i wouldn't want anybody having to go through what me and my friends went through this past Fourth of July weekend.

description: Nestled in the heart of the French Quarter, this 80-year old inn has been home to statesmen, magnates, and matriarchs of New Orleans society. Now you, too, can sleep beneath the Inn's grand ceilings and enjoy its charming hospitality! Visit our site to learn more about our amenities and guest rooms ... and reserve your stay with us for your next visit to New Orleans!
